unnormalised: And then there's Ms. Khan, SDM of Meerut, who's been promoted to Joint Secy in the Ministry of Agriculture. Good for her, I say! She’s known to be a straight shooter. Though I bet she'll miss all the power she had at the district level. Becoming a Joint Secy is great, but it's a different kind of ballgame in Delhi. All those endless meetings with PS to the minister, and the constant pressure from netas…whew!

They're the ones who actually draft the policies, do all the groundwork. Apparently, it's not about the designation, it’s about who has the real "setting" with the big bosses. He retired as Addl. Dir. last year. Claims he’s much happier now, spending his days playing cards and gossiping with his buddies.

unnormalised: It's a wild world, the government offices are. So many levels, so much hierarchy, so much jostling for power. From the humble peon to the mighty Governor, everyone's got a role to play in this great Indian drama. And at the end of the day, it's the aam aadmi who suffers. You can be a DM or even Sec. to GOI, but does anyone truly care at the end of the day? It's something to think about over my evening chai.
